intro: Phanerophlebia falcata, commonly known as the sword fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a well-developed rhizome that anchors it to moist, shaded environments. Its fronds are typically evergreen and can grow up to several feet in length. Phanerophlebia falcata thrives in humid climates and is often found in forest understories where it receives indirect light.
